results.title: The Academy of St Martin in the Fields at Longleat
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Martin Wyn Griffith, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the idyllic historic Longleat House in Wiltshire, England, this program of popular classics is performed by The Academy of St Martin in the Fields conducted by world-renowned Neville Marriner (also artistic director). Neville Marriner introduces the program and provides a commentary on the history of Longleat House and the music of the great composers of the 17th and 18th centuries. Beautiful images of the Longleat Estate, both interior and exterior, accompany the music to provide an atmospheric re-creation of those earlier centuries.

results.title: The Abyss [DVD]
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An American nuclear submarine is mysteriously attacked by an unidentified vessel and when the crew of the submarine go deep into the ocean bed to investigate they find a force so powerful it threatens the future of humankind. Technically a masterpiece, with awesome set designs and special effects, and a chilling soundtrack, “The Abyss” is a terrifying movie. Directed by James Cameron (“Aliens”), “The Abyss” is an extravagantly mannerist example of the science-fiction genre in which the “dark force” is a mirror for the destructive powers which humans unleash on themselves.

results.title: The Aborigines of Australia
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the aboriginal and part-aboriginal situation in Australia today (1964), showing some of the problems associated with their welfare and the policies aimed at their assimilation. Surveys conditions on government welfare settlements and mission stations, where different tribes learn to live together, and are taught new social, occupational and educational skills. Many work happily with other Australians in the Northern Australian cattle industry, but in towns stand apart from the rest of the community. Notes how social barriers need to be overcome if assimilation is to take place.

results.title: The Abode of peace
results.creator_credit: Ow Kheng Law, B.H. Hipkins and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: The British Protected Sultanate of Brunei lies on the northern coastline of the island of Borneo, between North Borneo and Sarawak. This film is an account of Brunei’s struggle to preserve the best of an old civilisation while using the new prosperity brought by the discovery of oil in the territory to build roads, schools and hospitals.

results.title: The ABC of unions
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A group of high school students, reacting against their harsh music master, devise an analogous story about why there are trade unions. They learn all about arbitration, bargaining and compromise. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The ABC of puppets
results.creator_credit: Portia Hawley and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film in two parts. Part 1 illustrates the processes of making a glove puppet in detail. Part 2 shows the construction of a stage for the puppets and their manipulation. The story of Hansel and Gretel is performed.

results.title: The ABC of It
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Brian Adams and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: An impressionistic look at the many aspects of the Australian Broadcasting Commission, showing film crews on location and in the studio; collation and broadcasting of daily news; events; ethnic radio; orchestral performances; sporting events coverage; and rating surveys.
